bug.author: parasj
bug.summary: On wandb 0.10.8, wandb sweep agent returns JSON TypeError
bug.description: Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS Kernel: Linux 5.4.0-40-generic wandb version: 0.10.8 Python version: Python 3.8.6 Problem: When launching the wandb sweep agent, I receive a JSON TypeError. I do not receive this error in wandb client version 0.10.7. <denchmark-code>wandb agent --count 1 cfq/sweep_mcd1_bert/bz0242i3 wandb: Starting wandb agent üïµÔ∏è 2020-11-03 23:42:48,982 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Running runs: [] 2020-11-03 23:42:50,803 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Agent received command: run 2020-11-03 23:42:50,803 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Agent starting run with config: <config here> 2020-11-03 23:42:50,977 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - About to run command: /usr/bin/env python cfq/train.py <config here> 2020-11-03 23:42:55,990 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Running runs: ['66jpdb1t'] I1103 23:43:14.621650 139774860945216 wandb_settings.py:606] setting login settings: {} wandb: Currently logged in as: paras (use `wandb login --relogin` to force relogin) wandb: WARNING Ignored wandb.init() arg project when running a sweep wandb: WARNING Ignored wandb.init() arg entity when running a sweep Thread SenderThread: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/wandb/internal/internal_util.py", line 33, in run self._run() File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/wandb/internal/internal_util.py", line 60, in _run self._process(record) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/wandb/internal/internal.py", line 232, in _process self._sm.send(record) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/wandb/internal/sender.py", line 91, in send send_handler(record) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/wandb/internal/sender.py", line 358, in send_run error = self._maybe_setup_resume(run) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/wandb/internal/sender.py", line 319, in _maybe_setup_resume summary = json.loads(resume_status["summaryMetrics"]) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/json/__init__.py", line 341, in loads raise TypeError(f'the JSON object must be str, bytes or bytearray, ' TypeError: the JSON object must be str, bytes or bytearray, not NoneType Problem at: /data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/loggers/wandb.py 123 experiment Traceback (most recent call last): File "cfq/train.py", line 198, in <module> app.run(main) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/absl/app.py", line 303, in run _run_main(main, args) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/absl/app.py", line 251, in _run_main sys.exit(main(argv)) File "cfq/train.py", line 157, in main wandb_logger.watch(model, log="all", log_freq=100) File "/data/paras/miniconda3/envs/cfq_wandb_/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/loggers/wandb.py", line 132, in watch self.experiment.watch(model, log=log, comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.89. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/parasj>@parasj</denchmark-link> , can you update wandb to latest version, and check if this error persists?
Hi thanks for the 10.7 backtrace, could you please share the one from 10.8 as well?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tyomhak>@tyomhak</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cvphelps>@cvphelps</denchmark-link> , thanks for getting back to me. To clarify, the backtrace I shared is from 10.8 where I get the error. I am attaching all the traces from four wandb versions, and it appears the issue is localized to 10.8. I'm closing this issue since it seems like the bug was fixed.
On wandb 10.3, backtrace
wandb agent --count 1 cfq/sweep_mcd1_bert/wxunrt9e wandb: Starting wandb agent üïµÔ∏è 2020-11-09 15:11:21,222 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Running runs: [] 2020-11-09 15:11:23,608 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Agent received command: run 2020-11-09 15:11:23,609 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Agent starting run with config: batch_size: 32 bert_model_version: bert-base-cased cfq_split: mcd1 cosine_lr_period: 0 data_root_path: /data/paras/data_cache/cfq dropout: 0.5 gamma: 1 lr: 2.8486735831438822e-05 ntl_bilinear: True ntl_hidden_dim: 64 ntl_inp: 64 num_epochs: 100 optimizer_name: Adam run_dir_root: /data/paras/data_cache/cfq seed: 2 seq_model: bert sweep_mode: True w_pos: 0.9177750122648644 wandb_project: cfq_sweep_bert warmup_epochs: 8 2020-11-09 15:11:23,889 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - About to run command: /usr/bin/env python cfq/train.py --batch_size=32 --bert_model_version=bert-base-cased --cfq_split=mcd1 --cosine_lr_period=0 --data_root_path=/data/paras/data_cache/cfq --dropout=0.5 --gamma=1 --lr=2.8486735831438822e-05 --ntl_bilinear=True --ntl_hidden_dim=64 --ntl_inp=64 --num_epochs=100 --optimizer_name=Adam --run_dir_root=/data/paras/data_cache/cfq --seed=2 --seq_model=bert --sweep_mode=True --w_pos=0.9177750122648644 --wandb_project=cfq_sweep_bert --warmup_epochs=8 2020-11-09 15:11:28,906 - wandb.wandb_agent - INFO - Running runs: ['dqivwqg4'] 2020-11-09 15:11:35.343 | INFO | cfq.data:setup:149 - Initializing dataset at stage None 2020-11-09 15:11:35.345 | INFO | cfq.data:setup:154 - Loading data from /data/paras/data_cache/cfq/cfq/splits/mcd1.npz I1109 15:11:50.393635 140255908607808 wandb_settings.py:547] setting login settings: {} wandb: Currently logged in as: paras (use `wandb login --relogin` to force relogin) wandb: WARNING Ignored wandb.init() arg project when running a sweep wandb: WARNING Ignored wandb.init() arg entity when running a sweep wandb: wandb version 0.10.10 is available!
